dashboard.label: Replication Overview
dashboard.searchTemplate: `fb_data_from_today` `_fb_summary_recs(*)` | bucket _time span=1d | rex field=bucketId "^(?<idx_name>[^~]+)~(?<bid>\d+)~(?<bucket_guid>[-A-F0-9]+)$" | eval bucket_type=if(guId=bucket_guid, "db", "rb") | stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by _time, orig_host, bucket_type

html.div:
This dashboard shows the overall status of an environment utilizing the clustering feature of Splunk versions 5.x and higher. It indicates the amount of data which is indexed directly by the receiving indexer, and the amount of disk space taken up by replication copies of that data.
Note: Environments not making use of clustering will simply not have any replicated data shown on the graphs.
The panel titled Proportion of Replicated Data breaks out its display by indexer. This can highlight indexers which are disproportionately loaded.

single.title: Locally Indexed Data
single.searchPostProcess: `_fb_where_today` AND bucket_type!="rb" | stats sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS indexed | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(indexed)`

single.title: Replicated Data
single.searchPostProcess: `_fb_where_today` AND bucket_type="rb" | stats count, sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS replicated | fillnull replicated value=0 | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(replicated)`

chart.title: Proportion of Replicated Data
chart.searchPostProcess: `_fb_where_today` | eval bucket_type=if(bucket_type=="rb", "Replicated", "Indexed") | stats sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by orig_host, bucket_type | chart sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS "Disk Usage" OVER orig_host by bucket_type

chart.title: Local vs. Replicated Data Over Time (last 30 days)
chart.searchString: `_fb_summary_recs(*)` | bucket _time span=1d | rex field=bucketId "^(?<idx_name>[^~]+)~(?<bid>\d+)~(?<bucket_guid>[-A-F0-9]+)$" | eval bucket_type=if(guId=bucket_guid, "db", "rb") | stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by _time, orig_host, path, bucket_type | eval bucket_type=if(bucket_type=="rb", "Replicated", "Indexed") | timechart span=1d sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS "Disk Usage" by bucket_type
